CatDescriptText: Mr. Roosevelt Crawford, 833 Francis Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 10, 1958, pg. A2, with question: "Do you think that Negroes display any racial prejudice towards each other?"  Answer reads: "I've heard some people say that there is some shown at the University of Pittsburgh. However, in most cases, I don't think that this is so."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Roosevelt Crawford standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Thrift Drugs in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
